text: Romanichthys valsanicola, the asprete, is a primitive perch found only in Romania. Discovered in 1957, it survives only in the Vâlsan tributary of the Argeş river.Freyhof, J. & Kottelat, M. (2008). "Romanichthys valsanicola". IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. 2008: e.T19740A9008207. doi:10.2305/IUCN.UK.2008.RLTS.T19740A9008207.en.McGrath, Stehen 2020. Back from the dead. BBC News. It is a critically endangered species. == References == Category:Perciformes Category:Animals of Europe Category:IUCN Red List critically endangered species Category:Freshwater fish Category:Ray-finned fish
title: Romanichthys
